body_html:
Here is some more information about the underlying block-sparse operations:

  • None of the inputs, outputs, or gradients use the COO sparse matrix representation.
  • The sparsity pattern is a binary mask (D / block-size, N / block-size), representing the active blocks in the weight matrix.
  • The block-sparse weight matrix is a dense tensor (non-zero blocks, block-size, block-size).
  • The forward and back-propagation (DX, DW) operations return dense tensors.
body_text:
Here is some more information about the underlying block-sparse operations:

None of the inputs, outputs, or gradients use the COO sparse matrix representation.
The sparsity pattern is a binary mask (D / block-size, N / block-size), representing the active blocks in the weight matrix.
The block-sparse weight matrix is a dense tensor (non-zero blocks, block-size, block-size).
The forward and back-propagation (DX, DW) operations return dense tensors.
body:
Here is some more information about the underlying block-sparse operations:
- None of the inputs, outputs, or gradients use the COO sparse matrix representation.
- The sparsity pattern is a binary mask (D / block-size, N / block-size), representing the active blocks in the weight matrix.
- The block-sparse weight matrix is a dense tensor (non-zero blocks, block-size, block-size).
- The forward and back-propagation (DX, DW) operations return dense tensors.
